data.title: Alt-H shortcut on macOS overrides ₽ symbol in Russian keyboard layout
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

Alt-H shortcut on macOS overrides ₽ symbol (ruble currency sign) in Russian keyboard layout. So it’s impossible to type ₽ symbol in Atom. See ₽ on top right corner of H key on Russian keyboard layout: 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/105274/27917196-f8979232-6273-11e7-89c0-7243a05896f9.png)

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Switch to Russian keyboard layout
2. Press Alt H

**Expected behavior:**

₽ symbol.

**Actual behavior:**

Word deleted.

**Reproduces how often:**

100%

### Versions

Atom    : 1.18.0
Electron: 1.3.15
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.5.0

apm  1.18.1
npm  3.10.10
node 6.9.5 x64
python 2.7.10
git 2.13.2

macOS Sierra 10.12.5 (16F73)

### Additional Information

Because of this Alt-H shortcut [dot above](http://www.fileformat.info/info/unicode/char/02d9/index.htm) unicode symbol is also not available in English layout.

data.title: Feature: disable update download on metered connection
data.body:
### Description

FEATURE: Disable update download on metered connection, so data plan does not get drained

In Windows users have the ability to mark Connection as 'metered'
this option is to indicate spare use of data connection.

Atom does not ask to download update, therefore it drains the data plan.

This is an improvement for users on mobile connections

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Got to Network & Internet Setting in Windows 10 (Win 8 too)
2. Click WiFi Tab
3. Click Manage Known networks
4. Choose Desired Network SSID
5. Click Properties
6. Scroll down to metered connection
7. Turn metered connection On
8. Start Atom editor (old version)
9. Observe huge (~200MB) data usage whe Atom downloads update.

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]
Atom should check if connection is metered to not automatically download update

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]
Atom downloads data with update

**Reproduces how often:** [What percentage of the time does it reproduce?]
always

### Versions
C:\Users\jagod>atom --version

Atom    : 1.18.0
Electron: 1.3.15
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.5.0

Windows 10 64-bit

### Additional Information

data.title: ⌘ + ⌃ + ␣ (command + control + space | cmd + ctrl + space) does not open the Characters selector on macOS
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

⌘ + ⌃ + ␣ (command + control + space | cmd + ctrl + space) does not open the Characters selector on macOS.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open Atom (either in `--safe` mode or just `atom`) on macOS Sierra
2. Open a new file: press ⌘ + N (command + N)
3. Open the macOS built-in special character selector: press ⌘ + ⌃ + ␣ (command + control + space)
4. Wait forever.

**Expected behavior:** The Character selector opens.

**Actual behavior:** The Characters selector does not open.

**Reproduces how often:** 100% (`n_trials < 10`).

### Versions

`atom --version`:
```
Atom    : 1.18.0
Electron: 1.3.15
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.5.0
```
`apm --version`:
```
apm  1.18.1
npm  3.10.10
node 6.9.5 x64
python 2.7.13
git 2.13.2
```
`sw_vers`:
```
ProductName:	Mac OS X
ProductVersion:	10.12.5
BuildVersion:	16F73
```

### Additional Information

The Atom keybinding resolvers (⌘ + .) does detect that ⌘ + ⌃ + ␣ is pressed, but no Atom action is bound to it, nor does it trigger the system's Characters selector.

data.title: Let apm list only enabled packages
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

As [@lee-dohm  say here](https://discuss.atom.io/t/installed-packages-list-into-single-file/12227/19) right now `apm` let you list installed packages with `apm list --installed --bare > package-list.txt` (for backup or to install same packages on several computers with `apm install --packages-file package-list.txt`).
Would be greatly appreciated a `--enabled` parameter to list only enabled installed packages, the ones we really use. With the huge amount of packages out there is very common to install/try some and then just disable them to give another try later instead of uninstalling it, so the difference between the list of installed and the subset of enabled could be really big.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to terminal
2. Run `apm list --installed --bare --enabled`

**Expected behavior:** List **only** installed enabled packages.

**Actual behavior:** List all installed packages.

**Reproduces how often:** 100%

### Versions

    $ lsb_release -d
    Description:    Ubuntu 16.04.2 LTS

    $ atom --version
    Atom    : 1.13.1
    Electron: 1.3.13
    Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
    Node    : 6.5.0

    $ apm --version
    apm  1.14.1
    npm  3.10.5
    node 4.4.5
    python 2.7.12
    git 2.7.4

data.title: atom segmentation fault with clean build on Linux
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [ X] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

Atom crashes immediately upon running from the command line.  As far as I remember it was working one day, then after a system restart it would segfault no matter what, even after deleting my `~/.atom` folder and trying safe mode.

I also tried downloading the latest source and building from scratch, but I still get a segfault.  Even attempting to get the version results in a segfault.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. delete `~/.atom` config folder
2. run `atom --safe` from command line

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]
`$ atom --safe`
```
/usr/local/bin/atom: line 130: 12082 Segmentation fault      (core dumped) nohup "$ATOM_PATH" --executed-from="$(pwd)" --pid=$$ "$@" > "$ATOM_HOME/nohup.out" 2>&1
```

**Reproduces how often:** [What percentage of the time does it reproduce?]
100%

### Versions
`$ atom --version`
blank line

`$ /usr/local/share/atom/atom --version`
```
Segmentation fault (core dumped)
```

`$ apm --version`
```
 apm  1.18.2
 npm  3.10.10
 node 6.9.5 x64
 python 2.7.13
 git 2.13.0
```
(note: when I run `$ node --version` I get "v8.1.3")

I am running Ubuntu Gnome 17.04
`$ uname -a`
```
Linux knox-pc-linux 4.10.0-24-generic #28-Ubuntu SMP Wed Jun 14 08:14:34 UTC 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
```

### Additional Information

I can't figure out what I changed when this started happening, but I can try to get more info if anyone has ideas what to look for (gdb, etc.).  My main problem is that I don't know where to start looking since I don't get any error messages from `atom`.

data.title: Dragging 'Find results' ontop of Project View no longer allows moving of pane.
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [X] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Right click on folder in project click "Search in Directory"
2. Enter a search criteria and press Find All
3. Drag the search results tab ontop of the Project pane on the left
4. Now you have no way of moving it back again....

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]

Expect either a new pane to be added with the results, not overlapping, or allow the pane to be dragged back into a proper tab again.

**Actual behavior:**

![atom search pane bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1702638/27862911-8b871644-617f-11e7-9d1e-c995926954e8.gif)

**Reproduces how often:**

All the time

### Versions

Atom    : 1.18.0
Electron: 1.3.15
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.5.0

apm  1.18.1
npm  3.10.10
node 6.9.5 ia32
python
git 2.6.2.windows.1
visual studio 2015

data.title: GNOME dark theme - dialogs (like alerts) are still light
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

Atom comes with a dark theme and (AFAIK) integrates with the GTK3 libs GNOME is built on. It works flawlessy, but for the dialogs.

Example Atom dialog: https://pasteboard.co/GzvKAzh.png

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Setup a dark theme in GNOME shell
2. Open Atom
3. Create a new file, or open an existing one
4. Edit the file without saving
5. Close the file tab

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]
I expect the dialog to be skinned just like the rest of the application, if not by the system, by the atom's internal theme engine

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]
When a dialog/alert pops out, it's not skinned as expected (not respecting either the Atom's (even default) or the system's theme)

**Reproduces how often:** [What percentage of the time does it reproduce?]
Every time

### Versions

Atom    : 1.17.2
Electron: 1.3.15
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.5.0

apm  1.17.0
npm  3.10.5
node 6.9.5 x64
python 2.7.13
git 2.11.0

Linux Ubuntu 17.04 with GNOME shell

data.title: Assign screen-row to each line number as a data field
data.body:
Fixes https://github.com/justmoon/relative-numbers/issues/41.
Refs: https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14893#issuecomment-311430646.

Some packages rely on `data-screen-row` and/or `data-buffer-row` to provide their functionalities. As part of the editor rewrite, we accidentally removed `data-screen-row` from line number nodes, thus causing some packages (e.g. relative-numbers) to stop working.

With this pull-request, we are adding back `data-screen-row` on line numbers, which makes the packages relying on it work correctly again. As part of this bug fix, I noticed that we were not updating `data-buffer-row` and `data-screen-row` after initially constructing the element they referred to, so I have fixed this inconsistency in bcaf655.

I will merge this as soon as the build gets 💚, so that we can cherry pick it onto `1.19-releases` and let this pull-request go out with the next hot-fix release.

/cc: @atom/maintainers @avindra

data.title: Editor hangs/freeze with open a big (~4MB) file that only have a single long line
data.body:
First, thanks for your great work! I love this editor. :)

### Prerequisites

* [ X] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

Editor hangs with open a 5MB json-file, but it open successful a other 6MB json-file.

### Steps to Reproduce

Start atom and open (my) ~5MB json-file

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]

Loading the json-file. Other editors load it all in <1s

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]

Atom hangs with no response, so windows ask to wait or to close it. I have waited multiple times, never come back. CPU process is ~20% and RAM ~500MB.

**Reproduces how often:** [What percentage of the time does it reproduce?]

100%

### Versions

Atom    : 1.18.0
Electron: 1.3.15
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.5.0

### Additional Information

I think here is something in the file that atom not like. Other bigger files working fine. The difference here is that the file with issue is a single line json. Maybe that here the problem?

data.title: I need help with a syntax theme from Atom.
data.body:
### Hello, I am trying to create a simple syntax theme like _Classic Plus_ from Dev-C++. 
**My questions are:**

**1**: How i can put `#include <>` with `color: @green;` and `font-weight: normal;` but perserving this:
`&.syntax--control {
    color: @syntax-text-color;
    font-weight: bold;
  }`?

**2**: How i can put `()`,`{}`,`,`,`.`,`;`...  with `color: @red;` and `font-weight: bold;`?

I let you an image in which you can see this stuff in Dev-C++:
![captura devcpp](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29888894/27832934-e3edbd42-60d0-11e7-911e-e2c422eaa278.png)

An now, how this code looks on _Atom_:
![captura atom](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29888894/27833280-57966964-60d2-11e7-8a47-c24bc570165d.png)
If you need to see my `base.less`, tell me and I'll add it.

Thank you very much. :-)

Alberto.

### Stack Trace

```
At C:\Users\Ciro\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.19.0-beta2\resources\app\src\text-editor-component.js:3499

TypeError: Cannot read property 'update' of undefined
    at LinesTileComponent.updateLines (~/AppData/Local/atom/app-1.19.0-beta2/resources/app/src/text-editor-component.js:3499:28)

    at updateChildren (~/AppData/Local/atom/app-1.19.0-beta2/resources/app/node_modules/etch/lib/patch.js:77:13)

    at updateChildren (~/AppData/Local/atom/app-1.19.0-beta2/resources/app/node_modules/etch/lib/patch.js:77:13)
```

data.title: Docs do not mention getAllowedLocations() for Pane Items
data.body:
So ``getAllowedLocations`` is mentioned in the [Atom flight manual](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/package-active-editor-info/#constraining-our-items-locations), but it's not mentioned elsewhere in the docs. I thought I could implement just ``getDefaultLocation`` without having to also implement ``getAllowedLocations``, but I get the following in the developer tools:

`C:\Users\Owner\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.18.0\resources\app\node_modules\tabs\lib\layout.js:159 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'getAllowedLocations' of undefined`

It's also not clear to me if I can simply return ``'all'`` from ``getAllowedLocations``. The docs should explain both of these functions and specify that you have to provide both if you provide the other.

@lierdakil could you give this a look and see if it addresses the compatibility issues? Thanks very much for the report!

data.title: Freeze in project mode
data.body: I upgraded to 1.18.0 once there each time I tried to reopen it a project was already open and it would hang. Clicking on any other tabs would pop up an alert asking if I wanted to wait or close the project. tried quitting and restarting it a few times and this always happened. Finally closed the project and opened the project anew discarding the saved state and it seems to be working now. data.title: Show pending IME input instead of just the last typed character
data.body:
Fixes #14911.

Back in #13880 we revisited our approach to handling input events, greatly improving support for the [accented character menu](https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT201586) on macOS along the way. In that process, we also rewrote the logic for dealing with IME events, which caused in-progress IME input to be replaced with the last typed character while the IME panel was open:

![wrong-behavior](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14314532/27643959-0f04396e-5c55-11e7-838c-ac15ef580fbe.gif)

With this pull-request we will now show every character that has been pressed and, only at the end, replace the entire stream of character with the selected IME alternative:

![kapture 2017-07-03 at 11 28 24](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/482957/27786774-d8cc11f0-5fe2-11e7-8b7e-3fcbe8323f62.gif)

data.title: [v1.19-beta2] Custom gutter decorations lack `.decoration` CSS class
data.body:
Before #13880, all custom gutter decorations had an automatic `.decoration` CSS class (see [here](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/1f068bde629b8748c7e409e53d56dfadea22108d/src/custom-gutter-component.coffee#L82)).

Now, this is not the case (see [here](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/245f294cc3bb91ed8701b2f4028af94cac1f4101/src/text-editor-component.js#L1075) and [here](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/245f294cc3bb91ed8701b2f4028af94cac1f4101/src/text-editor-component.js#L3112)).

This actually creates some compatibility problems.

If this is intentional, I can work around. But it looks more like an oversight tbh.

data.body:

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

### Prerequisites

* [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode

### Description

The following file couldn't be moved to the trash.
/srv/www/htdocs/index.php
Is gvfs-trash installed?

the system i use (openSUSE Tumbleweed: KDE) recommend use gio trash (gio help trash for more infor)

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open Atom.
2. Select file and press delete.
3. Alert appear click move to trash.
4. Error Appear.

**Expected behavior:** File Deleted

**Actual behavior:** Error by package gvfs-trash

**Reproduces how often:** Everytime

### Versions
apm  1.18.1
npm  3.10.10
node 6.9.5 x64
python 2.7.13
git

OS info

 Kernel: x86_64 Linux 4.11.7-1-default

WM: KWin
CPU: Intel Core i5-2430M @ 4x 3GHz [69.0°C]
GPU: intel
RAM:5744MiB

what the OS said:
gvfs-trash
This tool has been deprecated, use 'gio trash' instead.
See 'gio help trash' for more info.

data.title: Canceling "Add project folder" operation leads to a bug
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [ ] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

After clearing the project out of projects and attempting to add the first project folder
and afterwards canceling the operation, Atom will bring back the previous project folders 
I already closed.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open Atom
2. Add a project folder
3. Close Atom
4. Open Atom
5. Remove the project folder
6. Attempt to add a project folder, but press Cancel instead.

**Expected behavior:** No project will be added. Editor environment will be clean(Without any open projects)

**Actual behavior:** The Previous closed project appeared again.

**Reproduces how often:** All the time.

### Versions

Atom    : 1.18.0
Electron: 1.4.16
Chrome  : 53.0.2785.143
Node    : 6.5.0

data.title: Atom freezes intermittently whenever I have any project folder
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

Atom consistently hangs up/ freezes whenever I have a project folder or had one since it has been open. Happens even in safe mode. I've checked many threads and none of them had a solution for my problem, nor did they fit my description well. I've already uninstalled and reinstalled atom, tried the beta, cleared the window state, deleted my .atom folder, upgraded my graphics drivers, disabled and uninstalled all packages, commented out my entire init file, and disabled my anti-virus.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Start atom without any project folders or files open.
2. Click around and open settings, switch tabs, write some code; no freezing, works flawlessly.
3. File > add project folder (Happens with every folder I have tried)
4. Step 2 again, every 10 seconds or so, haven't timed it, Atom will just freeze completely.
5. Remove project folder that was added in step 3
6. Repeat step 2 again and find that the results are the same as those from step 4.

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]
No freezing

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]
Freezing

**Reproduces how often:** [What percentage of the time does it reproduce?]
50% of the time I have a project folder

### Versions
Atom    : 1.18.0
Electron: 1.3.15
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.5.0
apm  1.18.1
npm  3.10.10
node 6.9.5 x64
python 3.6.1
git 2.8.0.windows.1
visual studio
Windows 10 64bit

### Additional Information

Below is the cpuprofile I saved when I was reproducing the issue. In this profile, atom froze up 4 times, which I think is conveyed through the cpu profile if that helps. I also get the error `Failed to clear temp storage: It was determined that certain files are unsafe for access within a Web application, or that too many calls are being made on file resources. SecurityError` whenever I start up Atom.

[CPU-20170701T155442.zip](https://github.com/atom/atom/files/1117469/CPU-20170701T155442.zip)
